page.title: 03Local History
page.content:
LOCAL HISTORY OF DELABOLE.
The O.S. map of 1883 does not mark the village of Delabole but shows the three hamlets of{Pengelly, {Meadrose}and{Rockhead,}whose names live on as street names. In 1893 the{railway}came to North Cornwall. It was built alongside and the station took its name from the {Delabole Slate Quarry.}The three original hamlets, linked by Victorian ribbon building along the main road, also took the name of Delabole and the village is named as such on the O.S. map of 1907. {Delabole Station}only lated for 70 years. By orders of Dr. Beeching, the railway was closed in 1963 and the station building is now a private house.
